fields.description:
Following our upgrade to JIRA version 5.2.11, one of our workflows is experiencing an issue.  When a new ticket is created, and then the "Approve" button is pressed to move it through the workflow to the next step, the error "There were errors loading the issue." appears at the top of the screen and the ticket does not appear to advance through the workflow. However, if the browser is then refreshed, or you navigate to the ticket again, it will appear to be in the next step of the workflow - except that no transition buttons appear at all.

fields.description:
We are unable to enter the following URL as a Web Link in a Jira issue...

https://beta.autodesk.com/project/forum/thread.html?cap=495a377e9dee4a2c885cb50f6fc204d4&forid={cb92d6f1-e4d4-475d-a864-838158d7f121}&topid={781533f1-eb4e-4275-a564-28c94df558f7}&tp=1&to=asc&ts=last&tl=15&tv=desc#{6A5BFED5-32D8-47BE-B58D-1077FD295AC8}

While attempting to add the web link, it is rejected with the following message...
     Invalid 'URL'. Make sure you include the full URL (e.g. http://www.google.com).

The link can be cut-n-pasted into a URL bar (e.g. FireFox) and runs fine.
Appears to be a URL parser bug with JIRA (such as inability to handle the { } braces).
fields.summary: Valid URL is rejected as a JIRA Web Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34029].
  {panel}

When I tried running atlas-create-refapp-plugin (ubuntu 12.04, amps 4.2.3, refapp 2.19.2), it created atlassian-plugin.xml file without a proper xml declaration (1st line of every valid xml file), like this:

{code:xml}
<atlassian-plugin key="${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}" name="${project.name}" plugins-version="2">
    <plugin-info>
        <description>${project.description}</description>
        <version>${project.version}</version>
        <vendor name="${project.organization.name}" url="${project.organization.url}" />
        <param name="plugin-icon">images/pluginIcon.png</param>
        <param name="plugin-logo">images/pluginLogo.png</param>
    </plugin-info>

    <!-- add our i18n resource -->
    <resource type="i18n" name="i18n" location="ui-plugin-xproduct"/>
    
    <!-- add our web resources -->
    <web-resource key="ui-plugin-xproduct-resources" name="ui-plugin-xproduct Web Resources">
        <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs</dependency>
        
        <resource type="download" name="ui-plugin-xproduct.css" location="/css/ui-plugin-xproduct.css"/>
        <resource type="download" name="ui-plugin-xproduct.js" location="/js/ui-plugin-xproduct.js"/>
        <resource type="download" name="images/" location="/images"/>

        <context>ui-plugin-xproduct</context>
    </web-resource>
    
    <!-- publish our component -->
    <component key="myPluginComponent" class="com.atlassian.plugins.tutorial.MyPluginComponentImpl" public="true">
        <interface>com.atlassian.plugins.tutorial.MyPluginComponent</interface>
    </component>
    
    <!-- import from the product container -->
    <component-import key="applicationProperties" interface="com.atlassian.sal.api.ApplicationProperties" />
    
</atlassian-plugin>
{code}

Although, after running atlas-create-refapp-plugin-module and creating a servlet module, it updated atlassian-plugin.xml file with a proper xml declaration:

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<atlassian-plugin key="${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}" name="${project.name}" plugins-version="2">
  <plugin-info>
    <description>${project.description}</description>
    <version>${project.version}</version>
    <vendor name="${project.organization.name}" url="${project.organization.url}"/>
    <param name="plugin-icon">images/pluginIcon.png</param>
    <param name="plugin-logo">images/pluginLogo.png</param>
  </plugin-info>
  <!-- add our i18n resource -->
  <resource type="i18n" name="i18n" location="ui-plugin-xproduct"/>
  <!-- add our web resources -->
  <web-resource key="ui-plugin-xproduct-resources" name="ui-plugin-xproduct Web Resources">
    <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs</dependency>
    <resource type="download" name="ui-plugin-xproduct.css" location="/css/ui-plugin-xproduct.css"/>
    <resource type="download" name="ui-plugin-xproduct.js" location="/js/ui-plugin-xproduct.js"/>
    <resource type="download" name="images/" location="/images"/>
    <context>ui-plugin-xproduct</context>
  </web-resource>
  <!-- publish our component -->
  <component key="myPluginComponent" class="com.atlassian.plugins.tutorial.MyPluginComponentImpl" public="true">
    <interface>com.atlassian.plugins.tutorial.MyPluginComponent</interface>
  </component>
  <!-- import from the product container -->
  <component-import key="applicationProperties" interface="com.atlassian.sal.api.ApplicationProperties"/>
  <servlet name="Admin Servlet" i18n-name-key="admin-servlet.name" key="admin-servlet" class="com.atlassian.plugins.tutorial.servlet.AdminServlet">
    <description key="admin-servlet.description">The Admin Servlet Plugin</description>
    <url-pattern>/adminservlet</url-pattern>
  </servlet>
</atlassian-plugin>
{code}

This is not a big issue, but still.
fields.summary: atlas-create-refapp-plugin creates atlassian-plugin.xml file without proper xml declaration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34028].
  {panel}

Fire a REST request /rest/api/2/status to the JIRA instance would takes up a minimum of 1.5 minutes or sometimes even more than 2 mintues. It seems that JIRA is locating all the active status which associate to the workflow and workflow schemes. 

The problem seems to occur when you have a really large list of workflows and workflow schemes association. The request spending 99% of the time on waiting the request to be completed in order to retrieve 70++ statuses from the JIRA instance as we can see in the following screenshot: 

!chrome_debug_tool.png|thumbnail! 

More result from JProfiler attached and a sample HAR file attached for further review.
fields.summary: /rest/api/2/status REST request performance
Custom Field (Type: Label) to display none value even though there is no proper value on it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34026].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Paste the following text into a \{code} macro in an issue description and save it:
{noformat}
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
Test                                                         Test
{noformat}
2. Notice that the right edge of the shaded code macro area is sitting nicely alongside the rightmost line of "Test" text.
3. Add one more line with the same content (so it's 23 lines within the code macro instead of 22) and save it.
4. You'll see for a split-second that the code macro still looks correct, then the width shrinks and everything is pushed over to the left side.

Note that this occurs _only_ if the user you're logged in as has Edit Issues permission. Remove that by whatever means necessary, and the code macro will expand to fill the full width of the Description field and this bug won't occur.
fields.summary: Code macros containing large amounts of whitespace wrap short of the entire description field width if the user has Edit Issues permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a group comment visibility on worklogs the restriction is not applied in the Activity Stream.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a test user (JIRA Users).
# Enable comment visibility to support groups as per [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options].
# With an admin user, log work on an issue and set the visibility to a group.
# Access an activity stream with the test user (JIRA Users).

h3. Expected Results

The Activity Stream does not expose information about the log work event to the user.

h3. Actual Results

The Activity Streams leaks the worklog comment, despite being marked as restricted to a specific group.

h3. Workaround

Disable group comment visibility, or ensure users only restrict worklogs to project roles.
fields.summary: Restricted Work Log entries show in the Activity Stream in JIRA Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34016].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When the HTTP 403 error is thrown via REST API, there is no way to distinguish when a "usual" failed login attempt has occurred. In both cases (wrong credentials or maximum login attempt) JIRA retrieves HTTP 403 error.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want a different error message when the HTTP 403 error is thrown (either for wrong credentials or maximum attempts).
fields.summary: Distinguish 403 error from REST authentication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34010].
  {panel}

h5. Problem summary:
* When we use Advanced Search in Issue Linking at Issue View page only by using JQL Queries, the page only return 10 issues
* If there are more than 10 issues for that JQL query, all others will be ignored. 
* To explain it better, please refer to the screenshots.
** issue_navigator Shows 14 issues
** Issue Link page only show 10 issues

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create DEMO project
# Use JIRA Data Generator to generate 100 issues
# Open DEMO-99 and go to _More actions > Link_
# Click on *search for an issue* link
# Search for "DEMO" in simple search or advanced search

h5. Actual behaviour:
* Only 10 results are shown
* Run the same search of "DEMO" _after_ adding those 10 issues, will continue to show the same set of results

h5. Expected behaviour:
* All relevant issues should be returned
* If the list gets too long, maybe the results can be returned in different pages. (Which can be navigated from the results.)
* Next set of search should automatically ticked the already-selected-issues
fields.summary: Search in Issue Linking at Issue View page only return 10 issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34005].
  {panel}

When clicking the Create issue button on the Summary page of a Project, the error says:
{code}
The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser{code}

User has Browse permissions but not Create Issue permissions.

How to replicate:
* create a new project
* Edit project permissions to:
- Browse Projects: Project Role (developers) (only)
- Create Issues: Project Role (users) (only)
* remove all groups from the Role(users)
* go to Summary and click Create Issue.

!create_issue_error.jpeg|thumbnail!

NOTE: The correct message is displayed if NO Group is allowed on the Create Issue (by removing groups from Create Issue permissions)
!create_issue_ok.jpeg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create Issue from the Summary page displays a confusing error if user doesn't have permissions.

fields.description:
If I try to retrieve an issue via the SOAP api (Method getIssue), and the issue does not exist in the JIRA database, a RemotePermissionException is sent back to the client. 

The Javadoc at https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html#getIssue%28java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String%29 says:

{quote}
    RemotePermissionException - If the user is not permitted to perform this operation in this context. 
    RemoteAuthenticationException - If the token is invalid or the SOAP session has timed out 
    RemoteException - if the issue does not exist or your dont have permission to see it{quote}

The Javadoc and the actual implementation do not behave consistently.
fields.summary: Jira Soap API does not follow the javadoc documentation

fields.description:
We used to have JIRA.DirtyForm (our home-grown one). Since some time we have another one brought in by AUI. This is bad because:
* may cause production code issues (not observed yet)
* causes test failures and may cause more.
* causes confusion when fixing test failures (developer thinks he disables dirty form, but he only disables the one he knows about) and contributes to hours of avoidable dev work
* additionally the AUI handler uses setTimeout and hence causes race conditions when trying to disable it in tests, which makes it even harder to manage

We need to:
* investigate if we want to adopt the AUI in its current shape (in particular important: being able to disable it in tests, which seems not to be easy at the moment)
* exclude the one we don't want
* for the AUI handler [~bbuchanan] is probably the point of contact
fields.summary: 2 dirty form handlers in JIRA

# Open the Quick Create Issue dialog

# Note that the Time Tracking field adds an Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate textfield
# Check the "Create another" checkbox

Expected:
# Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate fields are shown

Actual:
# Only the Original Estimate field is shown
fields.summary: Time Tracking field breaks after Creating an issue via the Quick Create Issue dialog

fields.description:
Fields that contain multiple inputs such as a Cascading Select, Time Tracking, Attachments, etc lose any modifications when you toggle the Project/Issue Type in the Quick Create dialog.

Steps to reproduce:

# Open dialog
# Add 3 attachments
# Uncheck one of the attachment checkboxes
# Modify both values in a Cascading Select field
# Add some values to the Time Tracking field
# Change project/issue type

Expected:
# Attachment checkbox state is preserved
# Cascading Select values preserved
# Time Tracking values preserved

Actual:
# Attachment checkboxes all checked (JRA-39426)
# Only the first Cascading Select field retains the value
# Both Estimate Fields are empty
fields.summary: Fields that contain multiple inputs not retaining values when toggling project or issue type in the Quick Create dialog

fields.summary: Exception thrown when displaying the Quick Create Dialog
NoopTokenAuthenticationManager should fail instead of returning null

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33979].
  {panel}

My team clones various issues to track recurring tasks that we need to do each sprint.  We have a few tasks that have, say 10, subtasks, one for each team member.  Each time we clone the previous sprint's tasks, we get a new "CLONE - " prefix on al the subtasks, which is tedious to remove.

We're using OnDemand so we can't customize the clone prefix.

Either of the following would work for us:
* Let us customize the prefix
* Handle clones of clones specially so that we get "CLONE6 -" or just "CLONE -" instead of stacked "CLONE -"s
fields.summary: Avoid stacks of "CLONE - CLONE - CLONE -" for repeatedly-cloned tasks

fields.description:
Upgraded over the weekend from JIRA 5.2.x to 6.0.4: tested with a  smaller system for final confirmation and decided to go with the upgrade.

Upon upgrading, the plugin system failed to initialize with multiple errors, all appearing as:

{noformat}
2013-07-20 21:19:41,130 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] Unable to deploy plugin 'com.atlassian.plugins.remotable-plugins-api-0.8.2' from 'Unit: /var/atlassian/application-data/jira6/plugins/.bundled-plugins/remotable-plugins-api-0.8.2.jar (1372752790000)'.
2013-07-20 21:19:41,130 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] Because of the following exception:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        at java.util.AbstractMap$SimpleImmutableEntry.setValue(AbstractMap.java:759)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.getCurrentLocalizedHeader(BundleImpl.java:442)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.getBundleHeaders(Felix.java:1404)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.getHeaders(BundleImpl.java:312)
        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.getHeaders(BundleImpl.java:294)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.util.OsgiHeaderUtil.getPluginKey(OsgiHeaderUtil.java:361)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager$BundleRegistration.install(FelixOsgiContainerManager.java:649)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager.installBundle(FelixOsgiContainerManager.java:503)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiBundleFactory.create(OsgiBundleFactory.java:128)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.MasterPluginFactory.create(MasterPluginFactory.java:78)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader.deployPluginFromUnit(ScanningPluginLoader.java:155)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader.loadAllPlugins(ScanningPluginLoader.java:89)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.PermissionCheckingPluginLoader.loadAllPlugins(PermissionCheckingPluginLoader.java:24)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.init(DefaultPluginManager.java:203)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraPluginManager.start(JiraPluginManager.java:62)
{noformat}

Lots of iterations later, including starting from scratch, various PostgreSQL versions, OS X v. Ubuntu, it turns out that the _immediate_ proximate cause on my production server is the presence of the -XX:+AggressiveOpts option in the JVM extra args in setenv.sh, as below:

{noformat}
JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY="4g"
JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY="4g"

#
# The following are the required arguments for JIRA.
#
JVM_REQUIRED_ARGS="-Djava.awt.headless=true -Datlassian.standalone=JIRA -Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true -Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true"

# Uncomment this setting if you want to import data without notifications
#
#DISABLE_NOTIFICATIONS=" -Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=true -Datlassian.mail.fetchdisabled=true -Datlassian.mail.popdisabled=true"


#-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#
# In general don't make changes below here
#
#-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# This allows us to actually debug GC related issues by correlating timestamps
# with other parts of the application logs.
#-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS=""
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:NewSize=1g"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:MaxNewSize=1g"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC"

JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+UseParNewGC"

JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+UseTLAB"
# JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+AggressiveOpts"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+OptimizeStringConcat"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+UseStringCache"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+UseCompressedOops"

JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -Xloggc:/usr/local/jira/logs/gc.log"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+PrintGCDetails"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+PrintGCDateStamps"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError"
JVM_EXTRA_ARGS="$JVM_EXTRA_ARGS -XX:HeapDumpPath=/usr/local/jira/logs"
{noformat}

In the end, I don't feel like this is highly likely to ever bite anyone, but I figured I'd record it because it might come in useful down the road.

I don't _believe_ this affected 6.0.4 when connecting to the HSQL built in database, but I can't confirm that as I don't have good notes as to whether I'd changed the JVM args before switching to PostgreSQL.
fields.summary: -XX:+AggressiveOpts with Oracle JDK 1.7.0_25, JIRA 6.0.4 and PostgreSQL 9.1 on Ubuntu 12.04 causes startup failures
Ability to change Issue priority icons and have it separated by projects

fields.description:
NoSuchDirectoryException: directory '/var/local/jira/caches/indexes/issues'

If indexes are corrupted and you remove them, Jira will fail to start because it does not try to recreate the removed directories. In fact it does recreate indexes but forgets about issues sub-directory.

Jira should be able to recreate missing index directories.
fields.summary: jira is not able to recreate indexes if they are corrupted and removed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33973].
  {panel}

The users' project roles page will show all the roles that users have in projects. The view page doesn't show how the users relate to the roles.

In edit view, there are tick boxes. Currently, these tick boxes show users' direct relation to the role (not via group). If the relation is done via group, the groupname will appear in bracket.

However, this can cause confusion if user tries to remove roles by un-ticking the boxes, save the change and in view page, the user will still be shown to have the roles. This only occurs if the user has the relation via group.

Screenshots:

h4. 1 - Before edit

!current.png!

h4. 2 - Edit view  - will untick the "Users" role

!edit.png!

h4. 3 - After edit

!after.png!
fields.summary: Users' project roles view is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33968].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two projects, One and Two.
# Create an issue in One, move it to Two.
# Delete the project "One", recreate it with the same project key.
# Move the issue from Two to the newly-created One.
# Try moving it back from One to Two.

The problem seems to be that when deleting the project "One", it's not removing the references to that project from the {{moved_issue_key}} table.

h4. Note
Note that these symptoms can still persist under different usage patterns - see JRA-42354
fields.summary: SQL exception "duplicate key value violates unique constraint 'idx_old_issue_key'" on moved_issue_key when moving issues between projects where one has been deleted and recreated
Allowing a project lead to select a different permission scheme or notification scheme

fields.description:
Plugins like GreenHopper and Service Desk which "do stuff" on JIRA start-up/plugin enabled event are suffering from a race condition with JIRA's I18n system. The plugin can (rightfully) request the translation of a key *before* it's i18n plugin modules have been registered with JIRA. This causes the translation to be returned as the raw key instead of the message.

This is affecting customers today.

h3. Workaround

For GreenHopper, please see the workaround steps as detailed in GHS-9193.
fields.summary: Race condition occurs between JIRA and plugins with i18n translation

fields.description: JIRA's time zone detection doesn't distinguish between different countries in the same time zone, and can lead to JIRA suggesting incorrect time zones.
fields.summary: Improve the Auto Detection of the Local User Time Zone
Provide an options for user to choose printable font size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33963].
  {panel}

To make certain special configurations like to allow issue navigator export more than 1000 rows of search, it is required to change the properties value in jira-config.properties and restart JIRA. 

Considering that there are already certain similar configurations e.g. jira.search.stable.max.results that are configured from JIRA's Advanced Settings in General Configurations page, it would be better if most of the other configurations currently done from the jira-config.properties file where equally available through the Advanced Settings, so that the administrator can set the value without needing a restart of the JIRA instance.

This would also make it easier for Admins to track all this configurations in one place rather than have them scattered in isolated places.

This is the reaction of one of our customers:
bq. wow, this becomes a maze to figure out which params are used, and where to find/set them...
fields.summary: Additional settings in JIRA Advanced Settings
IE8 sent redirection in AJAX request when it's loaded in Issue Tab Panel
Report with subtask roll up and hourly setting rather than minutes
Improvements on JIRA Mobile Interface
Uploading a JIRA Avatar in IE10 results in errors.
some sort of progress bar or dialog during install

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33954].
  {panel}

It would be useful to list somewhere the fields that are not supported for custom Issue Collectors. I know from the advanced usage that some custom fields can be added using custom JavaScript and I assume that fields such as "Due Date" can also be added, but I'm not sure.

Please also see the discussion on this at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/79461/issue-adding-custom-fields-to-issue-collector-template

To reproduce:

# Added Due Date and Linked Issues to the Default screen.
# Checked that Due Date and Linked Issues were not hidden in the field configuration
# Checked Permission Scheme: Allowed 'Anyone' to Schedule Issues, Allowed 'Anyone' to Link Issues
# Went to create an issue collector 
Made issue collector for my TEST project
Chose to collect issues as Bugs 
choose Custom for Issue Template Form
 
Result - The Due Date and Linked Issues fields are not available in the custom form
fields.summary: Document that Issue Collector does not support all fields
Inline Thumbnail images should open to overlay, same as in the attachments area

fields.description:
I've used a label named Sanity
then, I've used two other labels named : Automated, Manual. each issue that has the automated or the manual label has also the sanity label

The filter I used has 49 issues in total:
35 issues have two labels: Automated, Sanity
14 issues have two labels: Automated, Manual

->The total issues counts 98 (35*2+14*2)

The pie chart plugin counts the total issues correctly 

I'm us

fields.description:
Lets say we have a *user_A* with the following permissions:
# *Manage Watchers*
# *Browse Projects*
# But this user does not have the *Browse Users* global permission. 

When user_A attempts to add a user to the list of Watchers for an issue, he gets this screen: [^NoBrowseUsers_Permission.jpg] Basically the user cannot see any users in the list to add. 

However, user_A *can still* add users to the watchers list, but he has to type their username. Although the auto-complete doesn't work, if you type the *full username* and press "enter", the user will be added to the watchlist. 

Isn't this a security concern, when you don't want to allow user_A to browse other users, but you allow user_A to add usernames to the watchlist? 

*==== Steps to reproduce ====*
# Install JIRA 6.0.4
# Create a new project.
# Create user_A and add this user to the Manage Watchers and Browse Projects permission in the project's permission scheme.
# Remove this user from the Browse Users global permission.
# Create an issue, and get user_A to edit the Watchers list, and add another user via username. Observe that the autocomplete doesn't work but the username is still added.
fields.summary: User should not be able to add Watchers without the Browse Users global permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33935].
  {panel}

Currently, the Tools and the More Actions menus are quite long and the bottom ones are no longer visible on the screen. 
Consequently, it can be difficult to get to the bottom menu items.  
If you use the vertical scroll for the screen, then the menu option often disappears and then that option scrolls out of view for the user to select.  Or, you have to just know the order of the items and use the arrow key to navigate to it and press ENTER and hope that you selected the correct one. 

I have several support tickets each month because users are not seeing the menu options and don't know how to perform functions. 

We have many of our users on laptops with 13" or 15" screens and are in a resolution that is either 1024x768 or higher (the screenshots are using a 1440x900, Mac Air, 13" which is the highest available resolution for an Air's system. 

See attachment for current experience. 

Options could include categorizing some options into a single menu option and have the user drill to that level.  Or, as we had to do in our own web design due to a similar issue, we limited the vertical length to only display 10 items at a time and displayed a vertical scroll bar if more than 10 were listed. 

I do not believe it appropriate to require users to change their docking options or web browser setup if they are already meeting a 1024x768 resolution and are in a supported browser.
fields.summary: Design long menus to ensure menu options do not scroll out of view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33934].
  {panel}

Set up a custom tab for a project that is the URL for its roadmap and one for versions
Navigate to the project
Click on the Issues tab - The issues screen will display and is dependent upon the screen you accessed last; else, it will navigate to Summary
Click on the newly created Roadmap or Versions tab

The URL doesn't populate correctly - The URL associated with the tab is appended to the original URL when you clicked on the Issues tab.  (see screenshots)

I wanted to make it easier for managers who are not familiar with Jira and use it for managing, at a high level their projects. Consequently, they don't do activities, such as creating a version often. Plus, the roadmap link is more useful than the roadmap gadget since they can view all projects and expand to view the details. The gadget only shows projects with upcoming release dates, limits the results, and doesn't show the details. 

Thus, I wanted to make it easy for the managers to find what they are looking for. 

This bug, doesn't allow me to create these custom tabs. 

Expected Result: The URL associated with the tab should populate the browser URL - it should not append. 

The screenshots show where I was on the Issues tab, that happened to default to Versions. Then, when I clicked on the Roadmap tab at the top, the URL appended to the initial URL, roadmap is highlighted in the sidebar, but the content area is that associated with Versions.
fields.summary: If you have a tab that references an Issues sidebar link (such as Roadmap or Versions), when you navigate to it, it doesn't populate URL correctly

I wish to make my Jira environment public to our customers however all comments made on issues are by default unrestricted. I would like this to be the other way around where I can choose a group (Developers for example) and then un-restrict the comment for public consumption. 

This is how helpdesk systems (such as Deskpro, ubersmith etc) work and we can't use Jira for this type of work until we have it which will obviously impact on your licence growth. 

Thanks
S

fields.description:
I am not sure if this issue is relevant to the Zephyr Test issue type or not.  But  I am including that information just in case.

Summary:  An issue of type Test (provided by the Zephyr plugin) cannot be deleted

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Create an issue of type Test (using the Zephyr plugin) in a project for which the permission scheme allows you to delete issues, and within a JIRA instance where the UPM's delete issue operations are enabled for all of JIRA
2.  View the issue

Expected:  There should be a "Delete" option in the More Actions menu
Actual:  There is no "Delete" option in the More Actions menu

Notes:   I have double checked that I have delete issue permissions in the permission scheme used by the project.  And I have checked the Universal Plugin Manager's delete issue module and it is enabled.  I have also checked a Bug issue type in the same project, using the same permission scheme and I see the Delete issue there.
fields.summary: Unable to delete an issue type "Test" (provided by Zephyr plugin)
